citations.narrative:
An opened bag of Cheerios and dried cranberries used for feeding enrichment were stored on a shelf in the enrichment
area and countertop in the processing room, respectively. Neither food item had been placed in a container with a fitted lid
after opening. Failure to appropriately store supplied food items can compromise the nutritive value of the food items
provided to the animals, as well as enable easier access by bugs and pests to infiltrate the bags of food. All open supplies
of food and bedding must be kept in leakproof containers with tightly fitted lids. Only food and bedding that is currently
being used may be kept in the animal areas. Supplies of food and bedding must be stored off the floor and away from the
walls, to allow cleaning underneath and around the supplies.
Correct by September 5, 2024.

Multiple areas along the perimeter fence no longer stand at six feet tall at the facility. Upon inspection, one area measured
as low as 59.5 inches at the gate between the front building and left side of the perimeter fence. Additionally, a 7.5 inch
gap was observed between the ground and bottom of the fence near the Field Cage 10 building.
Having a perimeter fence in place protects the animals in the facility by restricting animals and unauthorized persons from
going through it or under it, permitting contact with the animals in the facility. Additionally, it serves as a secondary
containment system for the animals in the facility.
The perimeter fence must be of sufficient distance from the outside of the primary enclosure to prevent physical contact
between animals inside the enclosure and animals or persons outside the perimeter fence. Non-dangerous animals
housed in outdoor facilities require a 6-foot-tall perimeter fence around their enclosure and must be at least 3-feet away
from any enclosures or buildings, unless an approved variance has been issued in writing by the Administrator.
Correct by September 5, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the authorized person.
